lead_paragraph: Shola Olatoye said the Justice Department had been looking at “every facet” of the agency’s operations amid a review of federal funds for health and safety problems.

headline.print_headline: Agency Says U.S. Inquiry Into Housing Is ‘Expansive’
headline.main: U.S. Inquiry Into New York’s Housing Authority Is ‘Very Expansive,’ Its Chief Says

snippet: Shola Olatoye said the Justice Department had been looking at “every facet” of the agency’s operations amid a review of federal funds for health and safety problems.
abstract: New York City Housing Authority provides Justice Dept with more than 400 million records amid investigation into whether agency submitted false claims in order to obtain federal funding for assistance in resolving tenant health and safety complaints in public housing projects; included in documentation is information about cases of elevated blood lead levels among residents.
